awd_abstract_narration: The PIs propose to investigate a free fluid (nongel)                            electrophoresis concept for preparative and production                          scale separation of proteins and other biochemicals.                            Fractionation occurs in a column with alternating porous                        barriers and fluid chambers.  Axial flows, which vary in                        magnitude from barrier to barrier, oppose electrophoretic                       migration, causing the species in a multicomponent mixture                      to focus among the chambers.  The method is suitable for                        batch and continuous modes.                                                                                                                                     The scope of the proposed research encompasses binary                           separation experiments, mathematical modeling,                                  multicomponent experiments, extensions, and comparative                         evaluations.  The binary experiments will employ two                            chambers and one porous barrier to separate two proteins,                       e.g.  hemoglobin and serum albumin.  A mathematical model                       will be developed to help design multicomponent experiments                     and interpret data.  Extensions which can aid practicality                      and robustness will be performed.  Comparative evaluations                      will be made with other methods.
